formattedAddress: 55 Water St, New York, NY 10041, USA
adrFormatAddress: 55 Water St, New York, NY 10041, USA

originalText.text:
For three years DOT obstructs HOV lanes from Staten Island to NYC near the Hugh Carrey tunnel on the Brooklyn side. The parked DOT trucks in middle of the HOV lanes back traffic up all the way to Verazano bridge.
Complained multiple times. DOT really don’t care. Very disappointed to have my job future depend on incompetence and ignorance of HOV management of DOT as I arrive late to work.
It used to take 45 minutes to get to work, now It takes 90 minutes and more. Staten Island is forgotten borrow by all NYC agencies except toll collection.
Reached out to Mayor DB office. Shame on him for referring me back to DOT.
They really don’t care.

One Express bus rider from Staten Island

originalText.text: NYC DOT workers seem like they all have an attitude, nasty people, these bums are obviously not happy at their jobs, I've seen a DOT driver sounding off his air horn continuously on a residential street at a school bus picking up kids then proceeded to drive around the bus with stop signs out. Total disrespect for other vehicles and school buses or school zones. I've also seen them cursing out other drivers and throwing stuff out of their windows at other drivers, taking leaks on public streets on peoples cars. Somebody needs to straighten these clowns out.

originalText.text: Most corrupt department in all of nyc… it is very hard to comprehend how a city sets up parking traps all over the city with hidden no parking signs under scaffolding and updates parking with bike lanes but not the signs adjacent to the areas.

text.text: Most corrupt department in all of nyc… it is very hard to comprehend how a city sets up parking traps all over the city with hidden no parking signs under scaffolding and updates parking with bike lanes but not the signs adjacent to the areas.

originalText.text: We recently received a DOT sidewalk violation notice on 2/23/2021.  First problem: the letter was dated 12/7/2020 but the certified envelope is stamped 2/19/2021!  The violation contains several codes, letters etc.. The letter said call 311 for more information.  I called a few times but nobody at 311 has any idea on how to interpret the codes and symbols.  In particular, the the letter "A" and "5A" appears on the diagram a number of times...nobody at 311 knows what that means.  DOT recommends we hire a licensed sidewalk contractor who knows about DOT policies and requirements.  I found 3 such contractors.  They too don't have an idea about the letters and symbols.  We want to get the work done ASAP but have no way of knowing details of what is required.  We don't want to get this almost 15K to 20K job done then find out it was done incorrectly.  Why does DOT put citizens of NYC through this hardship.  I fully understand why they want us to fix the sidewalk...for safety and esthetics....but why make it difficult?  Can someone help interpret the diagrams so we can get the work done accurately?

originalText.text:
I've got a great idea!!!! why don't you guys refund me money on my tickets for never getting into a car accident???

Obviously the system is a complete failure just trying to steal money from the public.

While you're at it why don't you time the lights going out of Manhattan on the New Jersey side so people could flow right through the tunnels??? Durrrrrrrrrrrrrr? Why am I waiting at the tunnels? Could you get to work on that please!!!
